intro: Melandrium zhongbaense, commonly known as the Chinese catchfly, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in mountainous regions. It has hairy stems and leaves that are lance-shaped, with a distinctive appearance. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare species within its native habitat.
